intro: Barkhausia hiemalis, commonly known as the winter barkhausia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that bloom in late winter. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Barkhausia hiemalis is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and ability to bloom during the cooler months.
